overview: This JavaScript file initializes interactive behaviors for a healthcare website, including theme toggling, back-to-top visibility, skip-to-content accessibility, CTA tracking, search/filter/sort of service cards, FAQ accordion persistence, and tabbed content management. It also logs analytics events for user interactions.
interactions: Click theme toggle to switch between light/dark modes
Click back-to-top to smooth scroll to top
Click skip-to-content to focus main content
Click CTA links to log analytics events
Type in search input to filter cards
Click filter chips to toggle active state and filter cards
Change sort dropdown to reorder visible cards
Click FAQ buttons to expand/collapse panels and persist state
Click tab buttons to switch visible panels
data_flow: User actions trigger DOM updates and analytics logging via logEvent()
Theme preference stored in localStorage under 'theme'
FAQ open state stored in localStorage under 'faq-open-index'
Search/filter/sort functions manipulate DOM visibility and order of service cards
Analytics events appended to window.analyticsLog array
accessibility: ARIA attributes for theme toggle, back-to-top visibility, and FAQ accordion
Skip-to-content link focuses main content with temporary tabindex
Filter chips use aria-pressed to indicate active state
Tabs use aria-selected, aria-hidden, and tabindex for keyboard navigation
FAQ panels use aria-controls and aria-expanded for screen reader support
test_ideas: Verify theme toggle updates DOM attribute and localStorage value
Ensure back-to-top button visibility toggles after scrolling threshold
Confirm skip-to-content focuses main element and restores tabindex
Validate CTA clicks log correct analytics events
Test search input filters cards by title/description text
Check filter chips toggle active state and aria-pressed correctly
Verify sort dropdown reorders visible cards alphabetically or by popularity
Ensure FAQ accordion expands one item at a time and persists state after reload
Confirm tab navigation updates aria attributes and visible panel
Validate analyticsLog entries contain correct event types and payloads
